Thursday, Dec 16

December 16 (Renewables Now) - Closed-ended investment company 3i Infrastructure plc has lifted its shareholding in French wind, solar and hydropower developer Valorem to around 33%, the investment firm said today.

Jersey-incorporated 3i Infrastructure has poured EUR 25 million (USD 28.1m) into Valorem by taking part in a capital increase carried out by the renewable energy developer and power producer. The fundraising is aimed to support Valorem's growth plan to boost its installed capacity and development pipeline.

Apart from France, Valorem is also active in Finland and Greece. The company says on its website it has installed 1,100 MW of capacity, of which 530 MW is self-owned, while 5,200 MW of projects are under development.

3i Infrastructure became a shareholder of Valorem in 2016. According to it, the French firm is "well-positioned" to take advantage of market opportunities in France and benefit from renewable power development programmes in Finland and Greece.

(EUR 1.0 = USD 1.126)
